channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2024110649
item.description:
Report X-2024110649

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-20T12:31:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-08
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/7/24, BNSF Portland IMF notified LARS of destination container RNLU 100043 (billed hazardous), found to be actively leaking. Unit was d eramped and moved into the Safe Haven for containment. Upon inspection by US Ecology, it was confirmed to be a hazardous leak, observed approximately 5 gallons of Millwork Treatment (UN3082) leaked out the of a cracked IBC Tote. Leak was caused by a lack of securement and a heavier spool shifting on top of the tote creating a hole, causing the leak. US Ecology remediated everything on the concrete, including the wastewater in the Haz Pit.

item.title: Report E-2024110317
item.description:
Report E-2024110317

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-15
  • City: CLACKAMAS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPO experienced a UN2922 P&S Wire Wheel and Tire Cleaner release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the dock and trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged jugs were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. Absorbents, pads, and neutralizer were then used to clean the impacted area. All cleanup debris, cardboard, and PPE were placed into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
